get.summary: Returns a zipfile containing the translations in this file
get.description:
This operation always returns a zipfile, even if you request the export for 1 language. If you do not specify a `format`, the default `json` format will be used.
If you do not specify a language, you will receive an export for each language defined in the project

401.description: You don't have access to this project

404.description: No project or file by that name is found for your API-key. The error-messages will contain more info about the entity we could not find

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file we want to export

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The format of the exported files. Can be 1 of the 5 formats: json, po, xliff, resx or csv

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
The language code (locale) we want to have exported.
This should be one of the language-codes defined by the project, for instance: 'en-UK'.
If none is given, you will get a zipfile with exports for each language in the project

post.summary: Save a list of new translations for this file
post.description: Send a list of new labels to insert into this file

200.description: Acknowledgement of the success of the operation. Specific to this request, you will receive 'success = true' when the operation handled your array of Labels correctly but the import of individual Labels may have given warnings/errors which you will find in the `msgs`-property. You will also receive a success-message in the `msgs`-property when a Label is correctly added.

get.summary: Get a list of translations for this file
get.description: Returns an array of Label models. There are a bunch of query-params available to get a filtered list

X-Rombit-Pagination-PageSize.description: Number of records in the page

X-Rombit-Pagination-TotalPages.description: Total count of pages when paginating

X-Rombit-Pagination-TotalRecords.description: Total count of records when paginating

401.description: You don't have access to this project

404.description: No project or file by that id is found for your API-key. The error-messages will contain more info about the entity we could not find

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
The language code (locale) we want to filter on.
This should be one of the language-codes defined by the project, for instance: 'en-GB'.
If none is given, we will return all . This parameter is required if you use the `status` parameter or when use the `search` parameter.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only return translations with a status listed in the array you provide. When using this parameter, also define the `lang`-parameter on which you want to filter.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Only return labels where the search-string matches the label-name or 1 of the translations. Be sure to also set the `lang` parameter when using this.

put.summary: Save a list of modified translations for this file
put.description: Save an updated list of translations for this file. All translations should already exist, new labels will not be imported and you will receive an errormessage

200.description: Acknowledgement of the success of the operation. In case the `success` property is `false`, you will find 1 or more error-messages in the `msgs` array

post.description:
New projects POST their request for an API-key to this endpoint. Your request will be
forwarded to a Superadmin and you will receive an email detailing either your acceptance
or rejection.

200.description: Acknowledgment that we received your request

400.description: Error while processing your data. Most often this will be a Validation Error. You can find more info in the body

api_key.name: X-HTTP-API-KEY
api_key.description: We require a header 'X-HTTP-API-KEY' for all operations besides /register

api_key_projectadmin.name: X-HTTP-API-KEY
api_key_projectadmin.description: We require a header 'X-HTTP-API-KEY' for all operations besides /register

api_key_superuser.description: We require a header 'X-HTTP-API-KEY' for all operations besides /register

langHeaderParam.name: Accept-Language
langHeaderParam.description: Which language does the backend when returning messages

pageParam.name: page
pageParam.description: The number of the page. This is used in conjunction with the `page_size` parameter

pageSizeParam.name: page_size
pageSizeParam.description: How many records per page do we return?

validated.description: Contains the date this user was validated by an Admin

created.description: Date when this record was created

id.description: ID of the user in the ACPAAS Multilang backend

updated.description: Last time this record was updated

type.description:
Can be one of these 1-character strings:
'E': Error-message,
'W': Warning-message,
'S': Success-message

api_key.description: Your new API key. All your next calls will have to be done with this key

source.description: The source where we got this translation

created.description: Timestamp when this Label was made

id.description: The Acpaas ID of this label

label.description: Name of this label. Should be unique across your File.

updated.description: Timestamp when this Label was updated

public.description: Can the translations in this project be used as suggestions in other projects?

review.description: Translations are only exported/returned when they are approved by a Project Admin

crowdsourced.description: Can anybody with the project URL add/change translations?

created.description: Date when this record was created

updated.description: Last time this record was updated

from_lang.description:
The locale-code of this language of the original content. Examples: `en-UK`, `nl-BE`, `fr`, `sr-Cyrl`.
This is conform to how i18n defines locales.
A list of codes can be found at http://www.i18nguy.com/unicode/language-identifiers.html

to_lang.description:
The locale-code of this language of the translated content. Examples: `en-UK`, `nl-BE`, `fr`, `sr-Cyrl`.
This is conform to how i18n defines locales.
A list of codes can be found at http://www.i18nguy.com/unicode/language-identifiers.html

name.description: This is the long descriptive name of a language, for instance: `English`

locale.description:
The locale-code of this language. Examples: `en-UK`, `nl-BE`, `fr`, `sr-Cyrl`.
This is conform to how i18n defines locales.
A list of codes can be found at http://www.i18nguy.com/unicode/language-identifiers.html

updated.description: Last time this record was updated

name.description: The project name you are requesting

email.description: Your email address. This is the address we will use to send your API-key

public.description: Can the translations in this project be used as suggestions in other projects?

review.description: Translations are only exported/returned when they are approved by a Project Admin

crowdsourced.description: Can anybody with the project URL add/change translations?

created.description: Date when this record was created

updated.description: Last time this record was updated

DefaultResponse.description:
When you get get a status-code 200, this is the response you will receive.
The `data` property of this object will contain the specific data you requested: either an array of Models or 1 Model.
When the `success` property is `false`, you will find 1 or multiple error-messages in the `msgs` property

data.description: The data payload. This will often be a Model or list of Models

success.description:
Boolean signaling if our call was success (true) or if there's an error (false).
When set to true, you will find any response-data in the `data` property and you might have notices/warnings in the `msgs` property.
If this is set to false, we expect there are error-messages in the `msgs` property

created.description: Date when this comment was made

email.description: Email of the user who posted this comment

created.description: Time that this record was created

revisionCount.description: Amount of revisions we have for this label

locale.description:
The locale-code of this language. Examples: `en-UK`, `nl-BE`, `fr`, `sr-Cyrl`.
This is conform to how i18n defines locales.
A list of codes can be found at http://www.i18nguy.com/unicode/language-identifiers.html

updated.description: Last time this record was updated
